main event: A village site observer sighted two objects of KC type in Cloverdale, Indiana on April 8, 1960.
interesting points: The objects were stationary and emitted light that appeared periodically reflective., The observation lasted between 3 to 5 minutes., Observers speculated the objects could be balloons, aircraft, astronomical phenomena, or satellites., The report was filed by military personnel., The objects were described as similar to the shape of a flare.
sighted object: two objects of KC type, possibly satellites or high flying aircraft
witness description: Robert F. Schraff and Ronald L. Jones, military personnel
